title: Objectives and policies for the physical environment-- land, air, and water quality
context: ยง226-13 Objectives and policies for the physical environment&ndash;land, air, and water quality. (a) Planning for the State&rsquo;s physical environment with regard to land, air, and water quality shall be directed towards achievement of the following objectives: (1) Maintenance and pursuit of improved quality in Hawaii&rsquo;s land, air, and water resources. (2) Greater public awareness and appreciation of Hawaii&rsquo;s environmental resources. (b) To achieve the land, air, and water quality objectives, it shall be the policy of this State to: (1) Foster educational activities that promote a better understanding of Hawaii&rsquo;s limited environmental resources. (2) Promote the proper management of Hawaii&rsquo;s land and water resources. (3) Promote effective measures to achieve desired quality in Hawaii&rsquo;s surface, ground, and coastal waters. (4) Encourage actions to maintain or improve aural and air quality levels to enhance the health and well-being of Hawaii&rsquo;s people. (5) Reduce the threat to life and property from erosion, flooding, tsunamis, hurricanes, earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, and other natural or man-induced hazards and disasters. (6) Encourage design and construction practices that enhance the physical qualities of Hawaii&rsquo;s communities. (7) Encourage urban developments in close proximity to existing services and facilities. (8) Foster recognition of the importance and value of the land, air, and water resources to Hawaii&rsquo;s people, their cultures and visitors. [L 1978, c 100, pt of ยง2; am L 1986, c 276, ยง12]
